item.title: MoparClassic DAFUQ
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:12, topic:516201”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=634460.msg4283980#msg4283980 date=1366093043]

[quote author=tigerclan link=topic=634460.msg4283977#msg4283977 date=1366091899]

This is because it’s not checking object types. Those doors share the same id (but different types) as the object it actually belongs to.

I’ll fix it shortly.

Edit: There is a pretty big problem… The GameObjectDef is not completely accurate. It has the wrong types listed for things. For example, dummies are listed as type 1, when they are type 0. Tons of doors are messed up, so there really isn’t a clean way to fix this.

The only way I can think of doing this is using the information within the GameObjectLoc to fix it. But, I don’t have time to do that today.

Lol yeah I knew it was messed up definitions. Just thought it would be funny to post
[/quote]The initial problem wasn’t messed up definitions… The fix I made exposed the problem of the definitions being wrong.

I’m not following… You seem to have contradicted yourself
[/quote]The problem was that it wasn’t accounting for types. I made it account for types.

Then, the problem of the definitions being messed up came to light.

how’d you make it account for types?[/quote]By changing the IdType of ObjectActionManager to a tuple of ints (that represents the id and type) compared to a single int (that represents the id).

Read full topic
